comment: Simply reads of PowerPoints the whole entire class. Powerpoints are unorganized and not helpful at all. Score is calculated based on a few items: 4 tests (in person, no notes), 4 quizzes (online, lockdown browser), and 14 homeworks assigned on mastering bio. Just read the textbook and use study resources from the textbook and you will be fine.

Has pre-quizzes for each lab. Was given 3 attempts but grade not visible after taking it. Puts in quiz grades at end of semester. Grades lab worksheets at end, too. Was very lenient on the unknown report. Overall, he is a very fun and cool guy. Remembers all of your names.
Gives very unclear instructions and always had an attitude when you asked a question. I pass this class with an A but it was very stressful because he cannot teach.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader--Group projects

comment: There are 2 projects that are broken into multiple parts throughout the semester. One is done individually and the other is done in a group. Both were easy and he didn't grade rough on those. I received a 100 on each of the parts that were for the individual project even if I thought I did poorly. He can be a weird professor but overall easy!

You have to understand his humor or it will come off as rude. He does make me feel a little uncomfortable, but I guess he's just quirky. The labs were very easy. Easy online pre-lab quizzes, 2 easy lab data submissions, an easy midterm, a couple simple group projects, and a final poster presentation. He is strict on following the rubric.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: DONT TAKE HIM. this professor is literally the worst. not only will he show you attitude and act smart when asked a question, he'll literally make you feel like complete garbage. this lab was easy but he just made it difficult for no reason and literally kept us in class the whole entire time from 3:30-6:15. JUST DONT TAKE HIM!!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: There was a pre-lab quiz due before every lab. Two lab write-ups that weren't too hard, it was practically pulled from the lab manuals. Must print the entire lab manual or you'll get a zero. One exam (midterm) that was difficult, two practicals (one with midterm, one later on in semester) that weren't too hard. However, he gets close with students.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: We had challenging pre-lab quizzes every week, as well as two projects and two exams/practicals. He had very specific rubrics and rules for these projects and the labs so you really have to pay attention while he lectures. He is not a bad professor, but he made me feel slightly uncomfortable and I dreaded coming to lab every week.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Only had lecture in the summer. Grade consisted of 4 tests, 4 homework assign which were actually just quizzes, and attendance. He isn't the worst professor I ever had, but he's not great. Has very weird classroom rules and will get upset if you don't follow. Lecture is kinda boring, and there is a lot of note taking. Tests are doable.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: I enjoyed Dr. Tseng's class; he has a great & dry sense of humor. The key to success for me was to take diligent notes during class as well as reading the textbook and annotating from the textbook as well. His exam reviews are extremely helpful; for every review topic, write down everything he said from the notes and notable things from the book.

This is the hardest lab class I've ever taken, and I feel like it's 100% because of the professor. There are 5 tests, each weighing 17% of your final grade. Almost all free response and he doesn't give partial credit. While annoying, I could handle his attitude, but not getting an A in lab is just ridiculous. Not worth your time to take him.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: The class was well put together. There was pre-lab quizzes that can be difficult. The lab it self was not difficult. When writing your lab report, you had to follow the rubric or you will receive a poor score. Dr. Tseng himself was not a strict grader but he doesn't grade anything on time because he invested in his research. Not a bad professor.

Prof Tseng really knows his stuff, and he expects you to as well. He gives plenty of extra credit on tests, in class with clicker questions, and just for attending more than 20 or so lectures. If you ask stupid questions he might pick on you, but other than that he's very caring and accessible if you need help or have questions. Also pretty funny.

The last couple reviews are being a bit harsh. I had him for lab and lecture, and while his class was hard he wanted us all to do well. The tests were specific but nothing unreasonable. He had a dry sense of humor, and yes did make fun of us during lab and take months to grade lab reports, but I would still take his class and lab again.
Gets mad when you ask questions about the lab and always criticizes you. Very specific on his lab reports and he takes months to grade them..
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He is very strict!! He teaches way too fast and just reads off his powerpoint so his lectures are really boring. He is a new prof so he isnt very good. DO NOT BUY BOOK. it was never used. He doesn't allow phones or computers in class. His tests are really hard even if you study for hours b/c of his free response!! Try to take someone else!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: do not take!!!! stay away!!! Told our class that our test average was too high (71) and that means it was too easy because his test averages are usually around 69. Hes crazy hard. I dont know why KSU keeps him around when he deliberately said he wants us to fail

do not take this teacher. He makes intro biology way harder than it needs to be. He is hard to understand so sit in the front. You miss a lot of what he lectures by just trying to write down all his notes. He tells you to come ask for help but when you do he talks down on you for not knowing the information before hand. dont skip class!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Do not take him. All he does is read off slides and expect everyone to know what he's talking about. Gets mad if you ask questions. He's annoying and constantly says  "The key thing here is this" for every sentence. Doesn't speak great english and consistently skips words. Rude and overall unpleasent to be around. Tough grader and doesn't help.

He is a cool guy, but made me despise  genetics. The order in which he teaches it makes it is hard to relate the different topics to one another. Overall, it was confusing & I wish I didn't take it. All homework taken from Quizlet and test difficulty wan't consistent. The labs felt pointless & the student assistant did most of the teaching in lab.
He was always extremely helpful, and went out of his way to help me pass.
Sexiest man alive.

Had him for Bio I lab. Lab instructions were easy to follow and he checks up on you pretty frequently to make sure you're doing it right. Sometimes the pre-labs were a little hard, but if you do all your work and show up for every lab, there's no way you shouldn't get a decent grade. He's a bit of a joker, but he gets serious when it's important.

Grab your pencils and prepare to have many hand cramps, because this professor kicks his notes into turbo-mode and flies. Because of the small time window, the professor must cram a lot of information into a small class. Otherwise, he's extremely helpful, fun, and very interactive with his classes. His labs are useful to the lesson as well!

Great professor. Very helpful with the review sessions before the exams. Cool and funny. The homework he gives a week before every exam are the basically 60 to 70 percent of each exam, so you better study from it. Overall, a very good professor.
Very Helpful, hosted review sessions before tests, easy to get along with, easy to understand.
He has a very fast teaching style but otherwise very direct and understandable.
